text:
is a tension in the size of the window and the size of the model. Larger windows require large
models that are slower to train, whereas smaller windows require smaller models that are much
easier to ﬁt.
Intuitively, decreasing the window size allows for a faster activity detection, as well
as reduced resources and energy needs. On the contrary, large data windows are
normally considered for the recognition of complex activities
— Window Size Impact in Human Activity Recognition , 2014.
